6.2. Bond

6.3.1. Create UniTensor

  • Show Source

6.3. UniTensor¶

UniTensor is an extension object base on cytnx.Tensor. A UniTensor consist of three imporant parts:

  1. Block(s), which is a Cytnx.Tensor (or a list/vector of cytnx.Tensor). Block(s) store all the numbers(elements).

  2. Bonds, which defines the bond information associate to each rank.

  3. labels, which gives each rank/bond unique ID.

In the most simple example where we don’t consider any symmetry in our system, UniTensor can be think of adding these bonds and labels meta data around cytnx.Tensor. A UniTensor can be constructed using Bond object, or in the simple case directly converted from a Cytnx.Tensor.

Let’s take a look at this:

  • 6.3.1. Create UniTensor
  • 6.3.2. Tagged UniTensor
  • 6.3.3. UniTensor with Symmetry
  • 6.3.4. Accessing the block(s)
  • 6.3.5. Manipulate UniTensor
